009package imagingbook.common.mser;
010
011import java.util.Collection;
012import java.util.LinkedList;
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.mser.components.Component;
017import imagingbook.common.mser.components.ComponentTree;
018import imagingbook.common.mser.components.ComponentTree.Method;
019import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
020import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * Performs "Maximally Stable Extremal Region" (MSER) detection [1] on gray-scale images.
025 * See Chapter 26 of [2] for a detailed description.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] J. Matas, O. Chum, M. Urban, and T. Pajdla. Robust widebaseline
029 * stereo from maximally stable extremal regions. Image and Vision Computing 22(10), 761â€“767 (2004).
030 * <br>
031 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
032 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 */
037public class MserDetector {
038
039        /**
040         * Inner class defining parameters for MSER detection.
041         */
042        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
043                
044                @DialogLabel("Component tree method")
045                public Method method = Method.LinearTime;
046                
047                @DialogLabel("Delta")
048                public int delta = 5;                                                   // = \Delta
049                
050                @DialogLabel("Min component size (pixels)")
051                public int minAbsComponentArea = 3;
052                
053                @DialogLabel("Min rel. component size")
054                public double minRelCompSize = 0.0001;          // = \alpha_{\min}
055                
056                @DialogLabel("Max rel. component size")
057                public double maxRelCompSize = 0.25;            // = \alpha_{\max}
058                
059                @DialogLabel("Max component size variation")
060                public double maxSizeVariation = 0.25;
061                
062                @DialogLabel("Min component diversity")
063                public double minDiversity = 0.50;
064                
065                @DialogLabel("Constrain ellipse size")
066                public boolean constrainEllipseSize = true;
067                
068                @DialogLabel("Min region compactness")
069                public double minCompactness = 0.2;
070                
071                @DialogLabel("Validate component tree")@DialogHide
072                public boolean validateComponentTree = false;
073        }
074
075        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
076
077        private final Parameters params;
078        private ComponentTree<MserData> compTree = null;
079        private List<Component<MserData>> msers = null;
080        private double minSizeAbs;
081        private double maxSizeAbs;
082        private double maxVar;
083        private double minDiv;  
084        private double elapsedTimeMs = Double.NaN;
085        
086        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
087        
088        /**
089         * Constructor using default parameters.
090         */
091        public MserDetector() {
092                this(new Parameters());
093        }
094
095        /**
096         * Constructor using explicit parameters.
097         * @see MserDetector.Parameters
098         * 
099         * @param params a {@link MserDetector.Parameters} instance
100         */
101        public MserDetector(Parameters params) {
102                this.params = params;
103        }
104
105        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
106
107        /**
108         * Applies this {@link MserDetector} to the specified gray-scale image
109         * and returns a list of detected MSER components.
110         * 
111         * @param ip a gray-scale image
112         * @return a list of detected MSER components
113         */
114        public List<Component<MserData>> applyTo(ByteProcessor ip) {
115                long startTime = System.nanoTime();
116                compTree = ComponentTree.from(ip, params.method);
117                
118                if (params.validateComponentTree) {
119                        if(!compTree.validate()) {
120                                throw new RuntimeException("component tree not valid");
121                        }
122                }
123
124                attachMserProperties(compTree);
125                calcVariations(compTree, params.delta);
126                markMaximallyStable(compTree);
127                updateStatistics(compTree.getRoot());   // calcPointStatistics(compTree);
128
129                int imgSize = ip.getWidth() * ip.getHeight();
130                
131                this.minSizeAbs = Math.max((int) (imgSize * params.minRelCompSize), params.minAbsComponentArea);
132                this.maxSizeAbs = (int) (imgSize * params.maxRelCompSize);
133                this.maxVar = params.maxSizeVariation;
134                this.minDiv = params.minDiversity;
135                
136                this.msers = new LinkedList<>();
137                collectMsers(compTree.getRoot(), Integer.MAX_VALUE);
138                
139                this.elapsedTimeMs = (System.nanoTime() - startTime) / 1000000.0;
140                return this.msers;
141        }
142
143        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
144
145        /**
146         * Attach Mser data to all region tree components.
147         * @param tree
148         */
149        private void attachMserProperties(ComponentTree<MserData> tree) {
150                for (Component<MserData> c : tree) {
151                        c.setProperties(new MserData(c));
152                }
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * New version, works on components in any order.
157         * @param compTree
158         * @param delta
159         */
160        private void calcVariations(ComponentTree<MserData> compTree, int delta) {
161                for (Component<MserData> c : compTree) {                
162                        c.getProperties().variation = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
163                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
164                        if (p != null) {        // c is not root
165                                final int ld = c.getLevel() + delta;
166                                Component<?> cc = c;
167                                
168                                // find the next ancestor component (p) whose level val(p) >= vd :
169                                while (p != null && p.getLevel() < ld) {
170                                        // IJ.log("        hiC=" + hiC.ID + " hiC.parent.level=" + hiC.getParent().getLevel());
171                                        cc = p;                 // climb upward
172                                        p = cc.getParent();
173                                }
174                                if (p != null) {        // cc is not the root -->  pp.getLevel() >= vd
175                                        // calculate growth and assign to c
176                                        float ac  = c.getSize();                // size of the current component (c)
177                                        float acc = cc.getSize();               // size of the upper component (cc)
178                                        c.getProperties().variation = (acc - ac) / ac;
179                                }
180                        }
181                }
182        }
183        
184        /**
185         * We start from the root and walk down recursively.
186         * Every node is only visited once.
187         */
188        private void markMaximallyStable(ComponentTree<MserData> compTree) {
189                // initially assume all components are max. stable
190                for (Component<MserData> c : compTree) {
191                        Component<MserData> p = c.getParent();
192                        if (p == null) {                                        // the root is always unstable
193                                c.getProperties().isStable = false;
194                        }
195                        else if (c.getLevel() + 1 == p.getLevel()) {
196                                float vp = p.getProperties().variation;
197                                float vc = c.getProperties().variation;
198                                
199                                if (vc < vp) {
200                                        p.getProperties().isStable = false;
201                                }
202                                else if (vc > vp) {
203                                        c.getProperties().isStable = false;
204                                }
205                        }
206                }
207        }
208
209
210        /**
211         * Calculates point (coordinate) statistics for all tree components.
212         * We start at the forest root nodes and walk down recursively
213         * toward the leaf nodes. Each component carries a 5-element
214         * {@code long} vector of sums, where each element is the sum 
215         * of the corresponding elements over all child components.
216         * @param c the current component
217         * @return a 5-element vector of coordinate sums
218         */
219        private long[] updateStatistics(Component<MserData> c) {
220                if (c.getProperties().stats != null) {
221                        throw new RuntimeException(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": sums array should not exist yet!");
222                }
223                long[] m = new long[5];
224                //              if (c.sums == null) {
225                //                      c.sums = new long[5];
226                //              }
227                //              else {
228                //                      Arrays.fill(c.sums, 0);
229                //              }
230                // add local point statistics
231                for (Pixel p : c.getLocalPixels()) {
232                        final long x = p.x;
233                        final long y = p.y;
234                        m[0] += x;
235                        m[1] += y;
236                        m[2] += x * x;
237                        m[3] += y * y;
238                        m[4] += x * y;
239                }
240
241                for (Component<MserData> child : c.getChildren()) {
242                        long[] sc = updateStatistics(child);
243                        for (int i = 0; i < sc.length; i++) {
244                                m[i] += sc[i];
245                        }
246                }
247                c.getProperties().stats = m;
248                //              IJ.log("updateStatistics: " + c.toString() + " " + Arrays.toString(c.sums));
249                return m;
250        }
251
252        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
253        
254        /**
255         * Checks and collects component 'c' into {@link #msers}'.
256         * Started from a root component, recursively walks toward the leaf
257         * components.
258         * Diversity is the size ratio between collected components on the same
259         * path. I.e., to be eligible, the current component must be significantly smaller than
260         * the previously collected component. This starts with the largest component.
261         * @param c the current component
262         * @param ap the size of the closest ancestor component marked as MSER
263         */
264        private void collectMsers(Component<MserData> c, int ap) {
265                //IJ.log("collecting " + c.ID + " / " + msers.size());
266                int ac = c.getSize();           // the current component's size
267                //double diversity = (ap - ac) / (double) ap;
268
269                MserData props = c.getProperties();
270                if (props.isStable && 
271                                minSizeAbs <= ac && ac <= maxSizeAbs && 
272                                props.variation <= maxVar && 
273                                ((ap - ac) / (double) ap) >= minDiv) {
274                        
275                        //Mser mser = new Mser(c);                      // create a candidate MSER (with ellipse)
276                        props.init();
277                        double ellipseArea = props.getEllipse().getArea();
278                        double compactness = ac / ellipseArea;
279                        // ignore MSERs whose ellipse is too big (if turned on)
280                        // ignore MSERs whose size is much smaller than the associated ellipse (i.e., not compact at all)
281                        if ((!params.constrainEllipseSize || ellipseArea <= maxSizeAbs) && 
282                                        compactness > params.minCompactness) {
283                                this.msers.add(c); //this.msers.add(mser);
284                                ap = ac;
285                                props.isMserP = true;   // mark component c as a selected MSER
286                        }
287                }
288                
289                if (ac > minSizeAbs) { // continue unless size is too small
290                        // recursively collect components from all children:
291                        for (Component<MserData> child : c.getChildren()) {
292                                collectMsers(child, ap);
293                        }
294                }
295        }
296
297        /**
298         * Returns the list of collected MSERs.
299         * @return the list of collected MSERs
300         */
301        public Collection<Component<MserData>> getMser() {
302                if (msers == null) {
303                        throw new IllegalStateException("no MSERs available yet, call applyTo() first!");
304                }
305                return this.msers;
306        }
307
308        /**
309         * Returns the tree of detected MSER components.
310         * An exception is thrown if method {@link #applyTo(ByteProcessor)} 
311         * was not previously called.
312         * 
313         * @return the tree of detected MSER components
314         */
315        public ComponentTree<MserData> getComponentTree() {
316                if (compTree == null) {
317                        throw new IllegalStateException("no component tree yet, call applyTo() first!");
318                }
319                return compTree;
320        }
321
322        /**
323         * Returns the time required for the
324         * most recent invocation of {@link #applyTo(ByteProcessor)}) in milliseconds.
325         * {@code NaN} is returned if method {@link #applyTo(ByteProcessor)} 
326         * was not previously called.
327         * @return time required for MSER detection (ms)
328         */
329        public double getElapsedTime() {
330                return elapsedTimeMs;
331        }
332
333}
